result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Wayne Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sean Wayne Matthews is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sean Wayne Matthews was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

c: DA, Atty Smestad, Def, Jail and Hudson PD
Filed by Def and Atty. km

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Sean Wayne Matthews appeared. Case called at 8:13. ADA Kelly updates the court. Atty. Smestad agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 2 in 16CM83. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 16CM83. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 16CM83. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:

- Impose 20 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED 
  pending no further involvement with law enforcement for 1 year.
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge $200.00

State to provide an update at 6 mo. and 1 year .

filed by Del Matthews regarding Defendant. eif
Per SRN 3/2/16 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Pre-trial conference at 04-04-2016 02:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Isaac B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
